entry.title: Hacker Steals Customer Data From Circle, BlockFi, Other Big Crypto Firms
entry.summary: Hubspot said data was taken from "fewer than 30 HubSpot portals," but didn't provide a list of which accounts were compromised.

entry.title: FTX Adds Tennis Star Naomi Osaka as Latest Athlete Ambassador
entry.summary: Osaka will help lead initiatives to bring more women into Web3, and will receive equity in FTX and compensation in crypto.

entry.title: Avalanche, Ethereum Lead Top 10 Crypto Gains Over Past Week
entry.summary: Leading layer-1 networks like Ethereum, Solana, Cardano, and Avalanche posted some of the highest gains over the last week.

entry.title: Australian Senator: DAOs an 'Existential Threat' to Tax Base
entry.summary: The new legislative package proposed by Liberal Senator Andrew Bragg would see DAOs “regulated as a matter of urgency.”

entry.title: How xx messenger is Future-Proofing Private Communication
entry.summary: New app xx messenger's decentralized infrastructure and quantum resistance protects users' privacy—against the threats of today and tomorrow.

entry.title: Nearly $6 Billion in ETH Burned as Ethereum 2.0 Edges Closer
entry.summary: The second-largest cryptocurrency, Ethereum, has officially destroyed more than 2 million ETH via a burn mechanism introduced last year.

entry.title: How Rare Pepe NFTs Reclaimed Pepe the Frog—And Why They Remain Relevant
entry.summary: Pepe the Frog isn’t just one of the oldest internet memes, he’s also one of the oldest NFTs. After Pepe was briefly associated with the alt right, Web3 reclaimed the meme.

entry.title: Game Recognize Game: Tom Brady Says Autograph NFT Site 'Wouldn't Have Been Possible' Without Vitalik
entry.summary: Vitalik Buterin wasn't sure who Tom Brady was, but that didn't stop one GOAT from reaching out to another.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Elon Musk's Diamond Hands, Tom Brady Responds to Vitalik
entry.summary: Elon Musk is holding coins to hedge against inflation, U.S. politicians consider crypto rules, and two GOATs share a memorable exchange.

entry.title: 'The Days of Crypto Being Off of DC's Menu Are Very Quickly Coming to an End': Andrew Yang
entry.summary: Regulating crypto likely includes painting "a broader, more holistic, more accurate picture of the community," Andrew Yang says on the gm podcast.

entry.title: Andrew Yang on Crypto Regulation in DC: 'This Train Is Coming. What's the Cargo?'
entry.summary: Andrew Yang, the former presidential and NYC mayoral candidate, talked crypto regulation in DC on Decrypt's gm podcast with Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts. Yang says the days of little or no crypto regulation in DC are "very very quickly coming to end" and that the question now is what the new rules will look like.

entry.title: Yuga Labs Teases Bored Ape Yacht Club Metaverse With CryptoPunks, Cool Cats, Nouns NFTs
entry.summary: A trailer posted to social media suggests a 3D gaming experience powered by Animoca—but that hasn't been officially confirmed.

entry.title: How The Juno Network DAO Voted to Revoke a Whale's Tokens
entry.summary: Juno Network's Proposal 16 to dramatically shrink one whale's JUNO holdings passed, adding more nuance to the power of a DAO.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Crypto Market Bounces Back as Bitcoin Breaches 40K—Again
entry.summary: Meanwhile, Ethereum gained more than 14%, and Avalanche added over 22% in the last seven days.

entry.title: The Bored Apes Get Richer—And More Cringey
entry.summary: It pays to be a Bored Ape—with free APE tokens and more rewards to come. But the Ape universe is also a little embarrassing, and has fueled NFT hate.

entry.title: Are Web3 ‘Communities’ Vapid or Authentic?
entry.summary: Every crypto investment cult has its own "community." Is there a real human connection, or is it all just a bunch of coin marketing hokum?

entry.title: Ethereum Outflows From Exchanges Hit 2022 Peak as ETH Price Surges
entry.summary: Large outflows from exchanges are considered a signal that traders aren't looking to sell, a potentially bullish sign for Ethereum.

entry.title: FTX, Animoca Back $500M Crypto Gaming Platform on Terra
entry.summary: South Korean game publisher Com2uS is laying roots on Terra for crypto games with C2X, raising $25 million in a private token sale.

entry.title: DAO Treasuries Top $8.2 Billion on Ethereum, $1.3B on Solana: DeepDAO
entry.summary: Analytics website DeepDAO began tracking data for DAOs built on Solana earlier this week.

entry.title: Universal Boosts Metaverse Band Plans With New Bored Ape Ethereum NFT
entry.summary: The Kingship virtual band gets a new manager as UMG’s 10:22PM label spends nearly $365K on an Ethereum NFT.

entry.title: Crypto Phishing Groups Solicit Phony Aid Donations Amid Ukraine Conflict
entry.summary: Phishing scammers are using Russia’s Ukraine invasion to masquerade as aid organizations and solicit crypto donations.

entry.title: Crypto Exchange Binance Confirms Shutdown in Ontario, Canada
entry.summary: Binance has confirmed to Canadian regulators that it will no longer open new accounts for users in Ontario.

entry.title: GameStop Announces Launch of NFT Marketplace for Q2 2022
entry.summary: GameStop, the video game store beloved of millennials, has made a strong pivot to crypto. Now, it's launching a new NFT marketplace.

entry.title: Gitcoin Grants Have Raised More Than $1 Million in Ethereum for Ukraine
entry.summary: Gitcoin’s round for Ukraine has attracted participation from NounsDAO, ENS Domains, Filecoin, and other big Web3 names.

entry.title: Gitcoin's Scott Moore Talks Ukraine Fundraising Grant
entry.summary: Gitcoin co-founder Scott Moore tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson all about Gitcoin's GR13 grant, which is raising money for Ukraine and has matching participation from a range of Web3 names like OpenSea, OlympusDAO, NounsDAO, Polygon, Algorand, and more.

entry.title: What’s Hot on Twitter? Cryptocurrency and NFT Topics See 242% Growth
entry.summary: Twitter users have posted nearly 300 million tweets about cryptocurrency in the past three months alone.

entry.title: ApeCoin: What Is the Bored Ape Ethereum Token and Who Gets It?
entry.summary: Bored Ape Yacht Club owners can now claim the token, which will have utility and governance capabilities—plus other potential benefits.

entry.title: Warren’s Crypto Sanctions Bill Aims to Crack Down on Russia, Track Wallets With Foreign Ties
entry.summary: Cryptocurrency think tank Coin Center says the bill is "unnecessary" and "unconstitutional."

entry.title: Ethereum 2.0 Coming in Q2, 'Will Lay to Rest' Energy Concerns: Joe Lubin
entry.summary: Despite delays, Joe Lubin stands by his estimate that Ethereum 2.0 will arrive in Q2 "or possibly slipping into Q3” of this year.

entry.title: Coinbase Hit With $5M Lawsuit Over 'Unlicensed' Sale of Dogecoin, 78 Other Crypto Assets
entry.summary: A new class-action lawsuit takes aim at Coinbase's decision to list dozens of tokens that may be securities.

entry.title: Ethereum Startup Optimism Hits $1.6 Billion Valuation After Raising $150M
entry.summary: The Series B funding was led by top crypto investors Paradigm and Andreessen Horowitz.

entry.title: Bored Ape Yacht Club Ethereum NFT Sales Surge as ApeCoin Price Pops, Then Drops
entry.summary: The APE token launches to volatile price action following some $88 million in sales for Bored Apes and related NFTs.

entry.title: Coinbase Launches Crypto Wallet Support for Solana
entry.summary: The cryptocurrency exchange is adding Solana to its list of supported blockchains for its wallet browser extension.

entry.title: Fans of Captain Marvel's Brie Larson Are Not Happy She's Pushing NFTs
entry.summary: Brie Larson, who plays Captain Marvel, has been criticized by fans on social media for flexing her “lil corner” of the metaverse.

entry.title: Rarible Adds Polygon NFTs and Multi-Wallet Support to Marketplace
entry.summary: Another step forward on Rarible’s multi-chain roadmap as the NFT marketplace protocol adds the Ethereum scaling solution.

entry.title: The Importance of Layer 2: ConsenSys, Nomad, and LayrLabs at Camp Ethereal
entry.summary: Robert Drost, Head of R&D at ConsenSys, talks Layer 2s and building atop Ethereum with James Prestwich of Nomad and Sreeram Kannan of LayrLabs at Camp Ethereal 2022 in Wyoming.

entry.title: DeFi Blue-Chip Token Aave Up 17% Amid Latest Upgrade
entry.summary: DeFi’s largest lending and borrowing protocol Aave has just undergone a facelift. Now, its native token, AAVE, has jumped double-digits.

entry.title: TabTrader Adds Trading for iOS, Updates Android App
entry.summary: Trading terminal TabTrader has launched trading on its iOS app, along with updates to its Android app including multiple accounts.

entry.title: New Job Openings at Spotify Indicate a Move to Web3 Technology
entry.summary: According to two newly posted vacancies, the music streaming platform Spotify is planning to add Web3 experts to its workforce.

entry.title: ApeCoin Launches for Bored Ape Ethereum NFT Holders With Reddit, FTX, Animoca Execs on Board
entry.summary: Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian and FTX’s Amy Wu are on the board of the new BAYC-inspired ApeCoin DAO.

entry.title: Congressional Blockchain Caucus Leader Pushes SEC Chair Gensler for Crypto Clarity
entry.summary: The letter to SEC Chair Gary Gensler from Tom Emmer was co-signed by seven colleagues.

entry.title: ShapeShift, BeetsDAO Talk DAO Creation and Governance at Camp Ethereal
entry.summary: Jordan Garbis, co-founder of BeetsDAO, and Kent Barton, who does tokenomics at ShapeShift DAO, talk to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Camp Ethereal 2022 in Wyoming about how to start a DAO, the hurdles with growing them, how to handle tokenomics and reward structure, and how to approach bad behavior by DAO members. At the end, they also took questions from the audience.

entry.title: Ukraine President Signs Law Legalizing and Regulating Crypto Assets
entry.summary: Ukraine’s law “On Virtual Assets” was introduced last month and is now official. It will usher in a fully regulated crypto market in the country.

entry.title: Edward Snowden Slams Central Bank Digital Currencies: ‘The Risk Is Very Easy to Illustrate’
entry.summary: Whistleblower Edward Snowden compared the danger of CBDCs to Scrooge McDuck's giant money magnet in the cartoon "DuckTales."

entry.title: gm Podcast, Episode 5: Andrew Yang Wants You to Join His DAO
entry.summary: The former presidential candidate and NYC mayoral candidate has launched Lobby3, a DC lobbying DAO. He talks to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about his crypto journey, the potential of DAOs, and the need to blend a Web3 approach with "the old-fashioned way" to spur change in DC.

entry.title: Edward Snowden Talks Governments and Crypto, CBDCs, and Ethereum vs Bitcoin at Camp Ethereal
entry.summary: Edward Snowden gives an extensive interview to Marta Belcher of Filecoin Foundation for Camp Ethereal 2022, taped on February 27. He talks about how governments view crypto as "an evolving threat," how crypto "transforms power relationships," why he thinks Ethereum "suffers from the same privacy problems as Bitcoin," and why he views central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) as "crypto-fascist currencies."

entry.title: Musician Dillon Francis on Ethereum vs Solana for NFTs
entry.summary: Musician and DJ Dillon Francis and Big Night Entertainment managing partner Tim Bonito tell Decrypt's Kate Irwin about their deal for a Boston nightclub residency and record collaboration with DJ duo ESCAPΞPLAN, and give their takes on Ethereum vs Solana for buying and trading NFTs.

entry.title: Musician Dillon Francis: Why I'm Getting Into NFTs
entry.summary: Musician and DJ Dillon Francis tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin what drew him to NFTs, and heaps a lot of praise on DJ 3LAU for pioneering in the space and prompting more artists to get in.

entry.title: Joe Lubin Talks Ethereum 2.0, NFTs, and DAOs at Camp Ethereal
entry.summary: ConsenSys CEO Joe Lubin talked about Ethereum 2.0 timing and impact, the power of DAOs, and gave his honest take on NFTs, Solana, Polygon, and Biden's crypto executive order in an extensive fireside chat with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Camp Ethereal 2022 in Wyoming.

entry.title: Crypto and Effective Altruism: Sam Bankman-Fried Interviews Peter Singer at Camp Ethereal
entry.summary: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried sits down for a conversation with one of his heroes, the moral philosopher and Princeton University professor Peter Singer, exclusively for Camp Ethereal 2022, powered by Decrypt. They talk animal rights, climate change, effective giving, Bitcoin's energy use, and how crypto is helping Ukraine.

entry.title: #DecryptLIVE: Biden's Executive Order & Ethereal 2022
entry.summary: Decrypt's Dan Roberts and Decrypt Daily podcast host Matthew Diemer chat live in Wyoming about the crypto executive order and other insights from Camp Ethereal 2022.

entry.title: Decrypting the Week 10: Ukraine Welcomes Crypto
entry.summary: As Russia’s invasion of Ukraine continues, Ukraine has raised more than $50 million in crypto donations—in Bitcoin, Ethereum, Polkadot, and even Dogecoin. Decrypt’s Dan Roberts, Scott Chipolina, and Kate Irwin, joined by special guest Izabella Kaminska of The Blind Spot, discuss the biggest story in the world right now.

entry.title: Muneeb Ali: It's 'Easy to Make Fun' of NFTs, But They Are Here to Stay
entry.summary: On Episode 4 of Decrypt's gm podcast, Muneeb Ali of Stacks gave Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts his take on why NFTs are so triggering to people. He understands why they're easy to make fun of or "dismiss as a toy," but expects them to be used for a whole range of important business purposes in the future.

entry.title: NBA Alum Metta World Peace and Raymond Dong of Blanksoles Talk NFTs
entry.summary: Blanksoles, a decentralized sneaker company, announced a partnership with former NBA champion Metta Sandiford-Artest—better known as Metta World Peace, and before that Ron Artest—to launch "Metta Designsoles," a series of limited edition Solana-based NFTs and physical sneakers. They discuss with Decrypt's Jason Nelson.

entry.title: gm Podcast, Episode 4: Fighting Bitcoin Maximalism with Muneeb Ali
entry.summary: Muneeb Ali is a Bitcoin OG whose project Stacks, formerly Blockstack, pulled off the first SEC-approved token sale for its STX token. But even though Muneeb has become the leading advocate for building dapps on top of the Bitcoin blockchain, don't call him a Bitcoin maximalist. He tells Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts on the gm how he fends off maximalists on Twitter, what he'd do if he were Twitter CEO, and how the Stacks ecosystem is growing.

entry.title: FTX's Amy Wu Sounds Off on Dorsey vs Andreessen
entry.summary: On Episode 3 of Decrypt's gm podcast, Amy Wu, the head of FTX Ventures, gave Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts her take on the Jack Dorsey vs Andreessen Horowitz feud over Web3. "There’s this constant narrative and paranoia that Web3 will become centralized, just like the previous rise of industries and the Internet... I think it’s good for people to remain paranoid about it," she said. She also commented on a16z's huge size in the space.

entry.title: Ameen Soleimani and Isaac Patka of Moloch DAO at ETHDenver 2022
entry.summary: Ameen Soleimani and Isaac Patka of Moloch DAO speak with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2022 about the new Baal update to the widely-used Moloch DAO framework.

entry.title: The Graph's Tegan Kline at ETHDenver 2022
entry.summary: The Graph has become one of the essential building blocks of Web3, providing an organized reliable source of data for projects of all sorts. Tegan Kline, one of the Graph's founders, tells Decrypt's Jeff Roberts how it all works and what's coming up next.

entry.title: ShapeShift DAO's Kent Barton at ETHDenver 2022
entry.summary: ShapeShift DAO's Kent Barton speaks with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETHDenver to discuss the latest with ShapeShift and how the transition from a centralized organization to a DAO has gone.

entry.title: The View From DC: Blockchain Association at ETHDenver 2022
entry.summary: How are decisions in Washington DC affecting crypto? Decrypt's Jeff Roberts speaks with Kristin Smith, who leads crypto's biggest lobbying group, about Republican and Democratic views on the fast-growing industry. Smith also sheds light on the odd behavior of SEC chair Gary Gensler.
